nano.remexp.client.net
Class SocketConnector

java.lang.Object
  nano.remexp.ThreadHandler
      nano.remexp.client.net.SocketConnector
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class SocketConnector
extends ThreadHandler

This thread tries to connect to to the remote experiment's broadcaster.

Version:
1.1 23.08.2012
Author:
Dominic Bosch

Constructor Summary
SocketConnector(ClientApplet listener, java.lang.String url, int newPort)
          Instantiates an object of this class and starts to try connecting to the remote experiment's host address.
 
Method Summary
 void doTask()
          The lifecycle loop of this thread tries in intervals to connect to a remote host and passes the acquired socket to the listener that is in need for this socket.
 void releaseSocket()
          Releases the socket connector and gives it a new chance to connect to a host.
protected  void setHost(java.lang.String url, int port)
          Sets the host information this thread tries to connect to.
 void shutDown()
          Shutting down this thread by setting everything to null.
 
Methods inherited from class nano.remexp.ThreadHandler
didExitRunMethod, getThreadName, isAliveThread, run, start, stopThread
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

SocketConnector

public SocketConnector(ClientApplet listener,
                       java.lang.String url,
                       int newPort)
Instantiates an object of this class and starts to try connecting to the remote experiment's host address.

Parameters:
listener - The applet that handles the communication coming from and going to this socket.
url - The remote experiment's host URL.
newPort - The remote experiment's host port.
Method Detail

doTask

public void doTask()
The lifecycle loop of this thread tries in intervals to connect to a remote host and passes the acquired socket to the listener that is in need for this socket.

Specified by:
doTask in class ThreadHandler

setHost

protected void setHost(java.lang.String url,
                       int port)
Sets the host information this thread tries to connect to.

Parameters:
url - the url of the host
port - the port of the host

releaseSocket

public void releaseSocket()
Releases the socket connector and gives it a new chance to connect to a host.

shutDown

public void shutDown()
Shutting down this thread by setting everything to null.

Specified by:
shutDown in class ThreadHandler
